newsitem.title: FRANCE: France sells extra 2.525 bln Ffr of BTANs.
newsitem.headline: France sells extra 2.525 bln Ffr of BTANs.

text.p: France sold an extra 2.525 billion francs of two- and five-year BTANs after Thursday's auction, the Treasury said in a statement.
The extra sales took the total nominal value of BTANs sold this week to 20.183 billion francs, above the Treasury's expected sale forecast of 16 to 18 billion francs.
It sold an extra 1.423 billion francs of 4.50 percent October 1998 BTAN and 1.102 billion francs of the 5.50 percent October 2001 BTAN.
Following are the final results of this week's BTAN sales. MATURITY COUPON SALE AMOUNT AVERAGE YIELD
BID AMT/COVER NON-COMPETITIVE BIDS LOWEST ACCEPTED PRICE
PCT ALLOTED AT LOWEST PRICE* PAYMENT DATE
* PRICES ABOVE GOT ALLOTMENTS IN FULL NEXT AUCTION
19.DEC
MATURITY COUPON SALE AMOUNT AVERAGE YIELD
BID AMT/COVER NON-COMPETITIVE BIDS LOWEST ACCEPTED PRICE
PCT ALLOTED AT LOWEST PRICE* PAYMENT DATE
* PRICES ABOVE GOT ALLOTMENTS IN FULL NEXT OFFER
19.DEC

NOTE - Under the French system, primary dealers and central banks not only submit competitive bids at the auction, but also have the option, for a limited period after the sale, of buying extra bonds at the average auction price.
-- Paris Newsroom +331 4221 5452
